h2.title: Why Convert JPG to BMP?
h2.description:
BMP is a simple raster format that stores pixels without compression — useful for certain workflows:

  • No JPEG artifacts: Avoid repeated lossy re-encodes during editing.
  • Straightforward structure: Easy for low-level pixel manipulation.
  • Legacy/embedded apps: Some Windows tools prefer BMP.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: JPG/JPEG (image/jpeg)
  • Maximum file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: BMP (.bmp, MIME image/bmp)
  • Bit depth: 24-bit (no alpha)

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Very large output: BMP is uncompressed by design; consider JPG to PNG for smaller lossless files.
  • Transparency needed: BMP (24-bit) has no alpha; use JPG to PNG.
  • Upload fails: Ensure file is JPG/JPEG and ≤ 16 MB.

h2.title: What is JPG?
h2.description: JPG (JPEG) uses lossy compression to keep files small, ideal for photos and the web, but repeated saving can introduce artifacts.

h2.title: What is BMP?
h2.description: BMP is a simple bitmap format that typically stores raw pixels without compression. It’s large in size but easy for programs to read and manipulate.

h2.title: Use Cases: When to Convert JPG to BMP
h2.description:
• Editing loops: Avoid cumulative JPEG artifacts.
  • Legacy software: Older Windows tools that require BMP.
  • Development: Direct pixel access in low-level processing.

faq.question: Will BMP work on all applications?
faq.answer: BMP is widely supported on Windows and recognized by many other platforms. Some modern workflows prefer PNG/WebP for size efficiency.

faq.question: How much larger are BMP files than JPG?
faq.answer: Often several times larger (e.g., 5–20×), since BMP is typically uncompressed.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

faq.question: Are my files safe?
faq.answer: Files are processed automatically and not retained longer than necessary for conversion.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple JPGs at once?
faq.answer: This page converts one file at a time. For bulk needs, repeat the process or use a batch tool.

faq.question: Does BMP support transparency?
faq.answer: Common 24-bit BMP doesn’t include an alpha channel. For transparency, convert to PNG instead.

note: BMP output is intentionally large (uncompressed). For the web, prefer PNG/WebP/AVIF.
